message.content:
cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.NA, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with distributed computation clusters and matrix computation problems, which are typically studied in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The use of codes and matrices in the Rosenbloom-Tsfasman metric and universally decodable matrices suggests that the paper may also belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-categories. The numerical stability aspect of the paper may also place it in the Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) sub-category. Finally, the use of companion matrices and the consideration of computation order may suggest that the paper belongs to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
